DataElement.preferredName: Testicular Cancer Bilateral Diagnosis Timing Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to describe the timing of the diagnosis of bilateral malignant testicular germ cell tumor.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Malignant Testicular Germ Cell Tumor Bilateral Diagnosis Timing
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A malignant tumor predominantly affecting young men and often associated with cryptorchidism.  Seminoma is the most frequently seen malignant testicular germ cell tumor, followed by embryonal carcinoma and yolk sac tumor. -- 2004_Affecting both sides of the body, or a matched pair of organs._The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._The chronological relationship between temporal events.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A malignant tumor predominantly affecting young men and often associated with cryptorchidism.  Seminoma is the most frequently seen malignant testicular germ cell tumor, followed by embryonal carcinoma and yolk sac tumor. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: A malignant germ cell tumor that arises from the testis. It predominantly affects young men. Seminoma is the most frequently seen malignant testicular germ cell tumor, followed by embryonal carcinoma and yolk sac tumor.

Property.preferredDefinition: Affecting both sides of the body, or a matched pair of organs.:The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.:The chronological relationship between temporal events.

Concepts.definition: Affecting both sides of the body or a matched pair of organs.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.
The chronological relationship between temporal events.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Occurring at the same time or rate.: A malignant neoplasm that affects both organs that belong to a pair.

Concepts.definition: Occurring at the same time or rate.
A malignant neoplasm that affects both sides of an organ in a simultaneous or non-simultaneous manner.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A malignant tumor that arises at a site separate from another, primary malignant tumor in the same anatomic system.  It is not clear if metachronous malignant neoplasms represent new primary tumors or metastatic disease.  Examples include metachronous osteosarcoma of the bones that develops in patients with known primary bone osteosarcoma, and metachronous Wilms' tumor that affects the opposite kidney in patients with a history of Wilms' tumor.

Concepts.definition: A malignant tumor that arises at a site separate from another, primary malignant tumor in the same anatomic system.  It is not clear if metachronous malignant neoplasms represent new primary tumors or metastatic disease.  Examples include metachronous osteosarcoma of the bones that develops in patients with known primary bone osteosarcoma, and metachronous Wilms' tumor that affects the opposite kidney in patients with a history of Wilms' tumor.
